system_prompt:
You are a helpful assistant that answers questions about documentation.

Use the search tool to find relevant information from the course materials before answering questions.

If you can find specific information through search, use it to provide accurate answers.

Always include references by citing the filename of the source material you used.
Replace it with the full path to the GitHub repository:
"https://github.com/DataTalksClub/faq/blob/main/"
Format: [LINK TITLE](FULL_GITHUB_LINK)


If the search doesn't return relevant results, let the user know and provide general guidance.

parts.content: Can I join the course after it is starged?

messages.instructions:
You are a helpful assistant that answers questions about documentation.

Use the search tool to find relevant information from the course materials before answering questions.

If you can find specific information through search, use it to provide accurate answers.

Always include references by citing the filename of the source material you used.
Replace it with the full path to the GitHub repository:
"https://github.com/DataTalksClub/faq/blob/main/"
Format: [LINK TITLE](FULL_GITHUB_LINK)


If the search doesn't return relevant results, let the user know and provide general guidance.

content.question: Course - Can I follow the course after it finishes?
content.content:
Yes, we will keep all the materials available, so you can follow the course at your own pace after it finishes.

You can also continue reviewing the homeworks and prepare for the next cohort. You can also start working on your final capstone project.

content.question: Course: Can I still join the course after the start date?
content.content:
Yes, even if you don't register, you're still eligible to submit the homework.

Be aware, however, that there will be deadlines for turning in homeworks and the final projects. So don't leave everything for the last minute.

content.question: Course: When does the course start?
content.content:
The next cohort starts January 13th, 2025. More info at [DTC](https://datatalks.club/blog/guide-to-free-online-courses-at-datatalks-club.html).

- Register before the course starts using this [link](https://airtable.com/shr6oVXeQvSI5HuWD).
- Join the [course Telegram channel with announcements](https://t.me/dezoomcamp).
- Don’t forget to register in DataTalks.Club's Slack and join the channel.

content.question: When executing dbt run after fact_trips.sql has been created, the task failed with error: "Access Denied: BigQuery BigQuery: Permission denied while globbing file pattern."
content.content:
1. Fixed by adding the Storage Object Viewer role to the service account in use in BigQuery.

2. Add the related roles to the service account in use in GCS.

<{IMAGE:image_1}>

content.question: Edit Course Profile.
content.content:
The display name listed on the leaderboard is an auto-generated randomized name. You can edit it to be a nickname or your real name if you prefer. Your entry on the Leaderboard is the one highlighted in light green.

The Certificate name should be your actual name that you want to appear on your certificate after completing the course.

The "Display on Leaderboard" option indicates whether you want your name to be listed on the course leaderboard.

parts.content:
Yes, you can still join the course even after it has started. You are eligible to submit the homework even if you didn't register officially. However, keep in mind that there will be deadlines for turning in homework and final projects, so it's important not to leave everything until the last minute.

For more information, you can refer to the original source: [Course: Can I still join the course after the start date?](https://github.com/DataTalksClub/faq/blob/main/_questions/data-engineering-zoomcamp/general/003_3f1424af17_course-can-i-still-join-the-course-after-the-start.md).
